definition: God/Heavens

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
day/sky/heaven
God/Heavens
see 天荒地老[tian1 huang1 di4 lao3]
lit. heaven won't let the sparrows go hungry (idiom)/fig. don't give up hope/if you tough it out, there will be light at the end of the tunnel
pinyin: lao3 tian1 ye2 e4 bu4 si3 xia1 jia1 que4

sentences.english: It seems unfair. Except at the margins, there isn't much we can do about physical attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 似乎老天不太公平，我们不太能改变自己的长相。

sentences.english: Just to sing the autumn season Sad Song, jealously guarding one's the end of time?
sentences.chinese: 只为了吟唱一季凄婉的秋歌，独守一个人的地老天荒？

sentences.english: Omigod. So what does this meat have in mind?
sentences.chinese: 老天，那么这些肉怎么想？

sentences.english: I will be your Valentine until the end of time.
sentences.chinese: 地老天荒，我将是你的情人。

sentences.english: Leo: Oh, god. Didn't you see the Key F2 on the top of the keyboard?
sentences.chinese: 我的老天啊，你难道没看到键盘上方的F2键吗？

sentences.english: God why so much grief, and tears?
sentences.chinese: 老天何来那么多的悲痛，日夜泪流不止？

sentences.english: With poetic justice, the crisis recoiled against Paris and destroyed the franc.
sentences.chinese: 老天有眼，这场危机反倒使巴黎和法郎受害颇深。

sentences.english: One of the ways we train for godliness is by maintaining our physical health.
sentences.chinese: 保持身体健康就是我们为老天爷做的事情之一。

sentences.english: Years cardamom, who made who The end of life.
sentences.chinese: 彼年豆蔻，谁许谁地老天荒。

sentences.english: I would never believe that Londoners would pray for rain.
sentences.chinese: 我永远也不相信伦敦人会祈求老天爷下雨。

sentences.english: “My God, I used to climb that mango tree, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: “老天，我以前爬过那棵芒果树，”他说道。

sentences.english: Get your story straight and tell the truth for once for heaven's sake.
sentences.chinese: 看在老天的份上你要是编不圆谎就说一次实话吧。

sentences.english: Heaven only aided those who endeavoured to help themselves .
sentences.chinese: 老天爷只帮助那些自力更生的人。

sentences.english: But some are like, 'Oh, my God, now it makes sense.
sentences.chinese: 但还有些会说，‘哦，老天爷，现在知道怎么回事了。

sentences.english: They called down punishment on the people for their evil ways.
sentences.chinese: 他们祈求老天爷惩罚那些作恶多端的人。

definition: God/Heavens
Heaven/Providence/God/the day before/the sky above/to fly to the sky/to take off and fly into space/to die/to pass away
see 老天爺|老天爷[lao3 tian1 ye2]
to care for/to show concern for/to think longingly (of one's country)
providence/the Will of Heaven
decreed by fate (idiom)/destined/fated
retribution/judgment
to open one's eyes/to widen one's horizons
favor/to give charity to sb out of pity
alas/oh dear
interjection or grunt of agreement or recognition (e.g. yes, it's me!)/to sigh
to be born under an ill star
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
battle cry
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
interjection of surprise/Ah!/Oh!
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
to grant/to bestow
(taboo curse) damn it!/fucking
to think to oneself/to think/to assume
